question: 履歴書
sourceMnemonic: The <kanji>continuation</kanji> of being in someone's <kanji>boot</kanji>s and getting it written down, that's the <kanji>writing</kanji> of "walking in someone's shoes" so to speak. It gives you an idea of that person. It is a <vocabulary>personal history</vocabulary>, though it can also be a <vocabulary>resume</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
